# Software

I enjoy building open-source tools for science, mostly at the intersection of statistics, machine learning, and computational mathematics. Most projects are developed in **R** and/or **Python**, with their 
computational cores written in **C++** to ensure speed and efficiency. I focus on clear APIs, reproducible results, and practical performance. Click a package name to visit its documentation site, when available.

```{python}
#| label: build-software-tables
#| output: asis

import yaml, html
from pathlib import Path
from IPython.display import HTML, display

# --- Config: paths & icons ---
YAML_PATH = Path("list_software.yaml")

ICONS = {
    "github": {
        "alt": "GitHub",
        "src": "https://github.githubassets.com/images/modules/logos_page/GitHub-Mark.png",
        "height": 20,
    },
    "cran": {
        "alt": "CRAN (R)",
        "src": "https://www.r-project.org/logo/Rlogo.png",
        "height": 20,
    },
    "pypi": {
        "alt": "Python (PyPI)",
        "src": "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c3/Python-logo-notext.svg",
        "height": 20,
    },
    "matlab": {
        "alt": "MATLAB",
        "src": "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/21/Matlab_Logo.png",
        "height": 20,
    },
}

CAT_LABELS = {
    "sml": "Statistical & Machine Learning",
    "opt": "Foundational Mathematical & Computational Routines",
    "network": "Network Analysis",
    "geom": "Geometry & Topology",
}

CAT_ORDER = ["sml", "opt", "network", "geom"]  # display order

def repo_icon(url: str, which: str) -> str:
    """Return an <a> with an <img> icon for a repo link."""
    icon = ICONS[which]
    return (
        f'<a href="{html.escape(url)}" target="_blank" rel="noopener" '
        f'aria-label="{icon["alt"]}">'
        f'<img src="{icon["src"]}" alt="{icon["alt"]}" '
        f'style="height:{icon["height"]}px; vertical-align:middle;"></a>'
    )

# --- Load YAML ---
yaml_data = yaml.safe_load(open(YAML_PATH, "r", encoding="utf-8"))
if not isinstance(yaml_data, list):
    yaml_data = []

# Group by category key
by_cat = {k: [] for k in CAT_ORDER}
for d in yaml_data:
    key = (d.get("topic") or "").strip()
    if key in by_cat:
        by_cat[key].append(d)
    else:
        by_cat.setdefault("sml", []).append(d)  # fallback

# Build HTML per category
sections = []
for key in CAT_ORDER:
    items = by_cat.get(key, [])
    if not items:
        continue
    items.sort(key=lambda d: (d.get("title","").lower()))
    
    rows = []
    for d in items:
        title = (d.get("title") or "").strip()
        desc  = (d.get("description") or "").strip()
        website = d.get("website")
        
        # Package cell: link to website if exists
        if website:
            pkg_cell = f'<a href="{html.escape(website)}" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><code>{html.escape(title)}</code></a>'
        else:
            pkg_cell = f'<code>{html.escape(title)}</code>'
        
        # Repo cell: icons for PyPI, CRAN, MATLAB, GitHub (language-first order)
        repo_bits = []
        pypi_url = d.get("pypi") or d.get("PyPI")
        if pypi_url:
            repo_bits.append(repo_icon(pypi_url, "pypi"))
        if "CRAN" in d:
            repo_bits.append(repo_icon(d["CRAN"], "cran"))
        if "matlab" in d:
            repo_bits.append(repo_icon(d["matlab"], "matlab"))
        if "github" in d:
            repo_bits.append(repo_icon(d["github"], "github"))
        repo_cell = "&nbsp;&nbsp;".join(repo_bits) if repo_bits else "â€”"
        
        desc_cell = html.escape(desc)
        rows.append(f"<tr><td>{pkg_cell}</td><td>{repo_cell}</td><td>{desc_cell}</td></tr>")
    
    table_body = "\n".join(rows)
    section_html = f"""
<h3>{html.escape(CAT_LABELS.get(key, key))}</h3>
<table class="table table-sm table-hover align-middle">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th style="width:22%;">Package</th>
      <th style="width:15%;">Repo</th>
      <th>Description</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    {table_body}
  </tbody>
</table>
"""
    sections.append(section_html)

final_html = "\n".join(sections)
display(HTML(final_html))
```
